column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 103 of 121”
Table: 93
Capital Improvement Plan
Contingency List
DESCRIPTION

column1: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd )
column2: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd )
column3: CATEGORY: Maintenance of Public Properties and Performance Support (Cont'd )
Construct a 176 car parking lot on the vacant lot at the
intersection of Kecoughtan Road, Newport News Avenue and
Thornette Street.
Redesign Gosnold's Hope Park to better utilize the park
areas.
Demolish existing facilities and construct a new
environmental nature center and neighborhood resource
center.
Upgrade Museum exhibits to include more interactive
materials, exhibit cases for second floor changing gallery,
installation of freight elevator and purchase existing
warehouse storage for all large objects of collection in one
secure and controlled location.
Expansion to include a floating pier, with electrical and water
hook-ups, capable of mooring 24 transient recreational
vessels 26 feet in length or longer. Permanent restroom
facilities will be constructed at Mill Point Park adjacent to the
public Piers and would include a laundry room, showers and
restrooms for transient boaters.
Remove defective playground equipment from selected
schools and parks, and replace with new equipment.
Construct new office building and locker rooms.
Rebuild #1 Woods green complex to include drainage,
irrigation and bunker construction. Rebuild and renovate tees
and drainage areas with top soil and rip rap. Install two
modular portalets on the course.
Construct walking paths and bicycle trails throughout Thomas
Eaton Middle School and Cooper Elementary School yards
so they can be utilized as neighborhood parks.
